primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God (as Father and Son) enters the human story to rescue humanity from the 'wound' of distrust and the power of sin by giving Himself away.

tekstueel_bewijs: He came to achieve salvation for you.
He wrote himself into the world.
He will save his people from their sins.
Heal the wound and make it possible for you to trust him.
Inside the Godhead... glorifying each other.
The Lord had said through the prophet.
Unto us a child is given.
Save his people from their sins.
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is primarily the Receiver of a gift, though challenged to become a Subject of 'surrender'.

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit / The Doctrine of Grace
tekstueel_bewijs: Conceived in her is from the Holy Spirit.
If Christmas happened, you can be saved by grace.
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject, but the Spirit acts as the internal Helper of the incarnation.
helper.rol_van_geest: External power enabling the miracle of the Subject's entry.

tegenstander.identificatie: The 'Lie' of the Serpent / The 'Wound' of Autonomy
tekstueel_bewijs: That lie entered into the bloodstream of the human race.
We are sure that if there is a God... we will be miserable.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is an ontological 'warp' in human nature that prevents trust in God, originating in Genesis 3.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The hearer's response: surrendering authority to Jesus as the new 'Namer'.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The hearer can only surrender (Program 2) because they have seen God give Himself first (Program 1).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: Holy Spirit → Jesus/God ← The Serpent's Lie

voorbeelden_god_subject: He came to achieve salvation for you.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Joseph did what the angel commanded.

voorbeelden: You must have had sex with somebody.
He did not want to expose her.
God wants you to enjoy your life.
You'll always know the joy of acceptance.
He came to achieve salvation for you.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes God's 'ability' (Pouvoir) to save and heal, which then grants the hearer the 'ability' to trust. It rejects 'Devoir' (Moralism) as a means of salvation.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: The sermon moves from the tension of S1/S2 (Joseph's dilemma) to exposing that both ~S1 and ~S2 are actually the same 'lie' (the wound), finally resolving in S1 (God's self-giving).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God becoming the Subject who takes the initiative, making S1 the only path to true life.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; sin is described as a 'bloodstream' infection and a 'warp' that makes us miserable.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is explicitly theocentric. It identifies the human problem not as a lack of effort, but as a fundamental inability to trust God, which only God's action can fix.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: What little we learn about Joseph here does tell us he’s a pretty admirable guy.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He’s not a teacher who’s come to show you how to achieve your salvation but the God and Savior who’s come to achieve salvation for you.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Joseph is initially presented as a model of 'moral without moralistic,' but the sermon quickly shifts focus from Joseph's character to God's revelation.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon provides this: Joseph is not the hero; he is the one who must surrender his authority to the child.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the 'up and down' of performance; invitation to trust.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic healing: God acts, man receives and then responds.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'doctrine' of the incarnation to the 'psychology' of the fall is seamless and structurally sound.
spanning_punten: The tension between Jesus as 'Savior' (Gift) and Jesus as 'Authority' (Lord) is balanced by the 'Self-giving' motif.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Someone has to take your punishment... He gave his very life to die for our sins.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is the agent of the Incarnation, providing the 'Pouvoir' for God to become man.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; sin is a 'wound at the core of our being' that makes us incapable of trusting God.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the primary Subject of the 'Saving' program while correctly positioning the human response as a secondary, derivative program.

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: The hearer might initially identify with Joseph's 'admirable' character.
identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: The hearer as the 'wounded child' in the toy store.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Deepen the 'Receiver' role before moving to the 'Surrender' role.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is a healthy grace-oriented balance.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Ensure the 'authority' of Jesus is always linked to His 'self-giving' to avoid it sounding like a new 'Devoir'.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (the Lie) is already presented as a cosmic, internal infection.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in grace-oriented actantial structure, moving from human moral dilemmas to the deep structure of the Fall and the Divine rescue.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would focus on the Dorothy Sayers/C.S. Lewis illustrations; Greimas shows these are actantial metaphors for the Subject-Object relationship.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the name 'Immanuel'; Greimas explains why the 'Namer' must be the one with 'Authority' (Sender).
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that the 'Moralist' and 'Relativist' are actantially identical in their opposition to God as Sender.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Namer' actant to redefine the Axis of Power.
